sentence: Patients who provided written informed consent entered a screening period of up to 28 days to establish study criteria (visit 1) (Fig. 1).

Log-transformed biomarker data were evaluated by a linear mixed-effects model, with visit variable as a fixed effect and patient as a random effect to determine whether on-study biomarker levels at weeks 4, 12, and 24 differed from baseline, with two-sided 95% confidence intervals.Results
Patient Disposition
A total of 31 patients with IPF receiving background pirfenidone were screened, of whom 10 were deemed ineligible (Fig. 2).
No meaningful change from baseline was observed at weeks 4, 12, and 24 after vismodegib treatment (Fig. 3).
Changes in % predicted FVC from baseline for the 12 patients in the ITT population were within the known inherent variability for this endpoint (Fig. 4) [38–40].
Patients who provided written informed consent entered a screening period of up to 28 days to establish study criteria (visit 1) (Fig. 1).
